intro: Leuconocarpus, commonly known as the white-flowered false daisy, is a genus of flowering plants native to Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plants typically have narrow, grass-like leaves and produce small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. They are often found in arid or semi-arid regions and are adapted to withstand drought conditions. Leuconocarpus species are sometimes used in traditional medicine, though their botanical significance lies mainly in their ecological roles and ornamental value.
